newsitem.title: UK: Brazil mark Eurobond possible next week - dealers.
newsitem.headline: Brazil mark Eurobond possible next week - dealers.

text.p: Brazil was taking bids for a mark Eurobond this week and a deal could surface next week, syndicate managers said on Monday.
A 500 million mark 10-year deal was expected, they said.
Seven banks were said to be trying for the mandate, but it was difficult to pinpoint a likely launch spread due to the intense competition to lead manage the deal, traders said.
"Competition to get Brazil is very strong, and this will reflect in the pricing," said a Frankfurt-based syndicate manager. "It's likely to be below 300 basis points over."
Another trader said the deal was likely to be launched next week, subject to market conditions.

Brazil last tapped the mark sector in 1995, when it launched a 1.0 billion mark three-year deal. Other Brazilian borrowers, such as state development bank BNDES and Companhia Energetica de Sao Paolo (CESP), issued five-year deals in 1996.
Argentina and Mexico were also active users of Euromarks last year, tapping into German retail demand for high coupons.
In February Argentina is due to issue a mark bond for up to 1.5 billion marks. No mandate had yet been awarded, but a long-dated deal was likely, dealers said.
Last October it issued a 500 million mark 30-year bond, its longest-dated issue, via Deutsche Morgan Grenfell.
